title: Conversation: Joseph Cornell
hero_caption: Joseph Cornell, Soap Bubble Set, 1948. Lindy and Edwin Bergman Joseph Cornell Collection, © The Joseph and Robert Cornell Memorial Foundation / Licensed by VAGA at ARS, New York.
short_description: Please join us for a conversation between Jodi Hauptman, Senior Curator in the Department of Drawings and Prints at the Museum of Modern Art, New York, and Caitlin Haskell, Gary C. and Frances Comer Curator of Modern and Contemporary Art, about the work of Joseph Cornell. This discussion, marking the 50th anniversary of Cornell's death, will bring to light new research on the artist and the Art Institute's holdings conducted over the past year.
list_description: Please join us for a conversation between curator Jodi Hauptman, MoMA, and the Art Institute's Caitlin Haskell focusing on the work of Joseph Cornell, marking the 50th anniversary of the artist's death.
description:
Join Jodi Hauptman, curator in the Department of Drawings and Prints at the Museum of Modern Art, and Caitlin Haskell, Gary C. and Frances Comer Curator of Modern and Contemporary Art, for a conversation about the art of Joseph Cornell. This discussion, marking the 50th anniversary of Cornell's death, will bring to light new research on the artist and the Art Institute's holdings conducted over the past year.  

This program is made possible by the generous support of the Joseph and Robert Cornell Memorial Foundation.

About the Speakers

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum.

In accordance with state and City of Chicago guidelines, visitors to the museum are no longer required to wear masks or provide proof of vaccination. Anyone who would like to continue to wear a mask is welcome to do so. Learn more about our visiting policies and what to expect.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
